basics.name: Will Weaver
basics.label: Engineering Leader | Obsessed with Efficiency and Developer Experience | Board Game Sommelier
basics.summary: Experienced cross-functional manager with a demonstrated history of working with remote and in person companies of various sizes. Skilled at designing and building resilient applications and cultures by leveraging agile, lean, and devops practices. Passionate about creating mentoring groups to encourage continual growth and guidance. Platform engineer with extensive experience coordinating with product, engineering, and design leadership to shape developer experience. Avid board game player.

highlights: Founded a cross-functional team of 6 engineers working in Java, Javascript focused on developer experience.
Created and led the execution of a strategy to reduce the complexity, cost, and friction of our build, test, and release processes.
Streamlined delivery pipelines by creating standardized delivery mechanisms for CircleCI pipelines.
Delivered a new Tilt based local development process which was used by 80% of all actively developed services within 3 months
Piloted DX metric acquisition via Sleuth and developed supplemental metrics to support fine grained project tracking.
Managed code freezes and thaws during holiday rush to enable production systems to stay stable while also protecting the most revenue critical days of the year.
Managed the customer platform of five software engineers working in Go and Javascript.
Worked with design and and engineering leadership to craft a reporting framework that would allow developers to independently maintain their own applications while ensuring visual consistency
Enable independence for verification teams on the customer platform by creating self service tools for CI/CD of new verifications as well as libraries for generating customer reports.
Reduced the effort for deployment such that it was no longer required to be a Verica guided process and could be entirely customer managed by providing easy to use Helm charts.

Developed a technical direction, business strategy, and organizational structure for the Hyperscience platform teams in partnership with engineering directors, product management leadership, and VP of Engineering.

Founded both an agile leadership peer group and a management peer group resulting in formalized best practices as well as mentorship for newer leaders/managers as well as mentorship opportunities for more experienced leaders/managers.
Coached engineering managers as well as design managers on management practices as well as product lifecycle challenges.
Managed the delivery and display of customer notifications by web application, email, push notification, SMS, and Slack.
Led two 5 -10 person mixed teams of frontend/full-stack, and backend engineers working in Java and Javascript
Navigated refactoring parts of our monolithic web application into smaller modules enabling graceful degradation when
Migrated the polling-based messaging architecture to a lambda backed, push-based messaging architecture reducing the time to high importance messages during peak usage from ~10 minutes to ~20s.
Reduced the lead time of features by 50% and increase the amount of experimentation done by the teams by redesigning team QA practices and introducing additional automated testing.
Founded an agile leadership peer mentoring group to provide peer-to-peer mentoring, communication, and guidance on modern agile philosophy and practices.
Founded and then grew a cross-functional team from roughly 5 to ten software engineers and qa members both recruited both internally and externally

Led the design to stabilize and refactor legacy notifications system within Meetup both simplifying the underlying software design as well as reducing the number of messages sent by nearly 70% without impacting any show up based metrics.
Extracted core domain data and create a GraphQL API that allowed external teams to interact with this data via the API instead of directly.
Established goals, objectives, key results, and budgets b) working with stakeholdlers and executives.
I performed technical evaluations as well as contract negotiations for existing and new notifications vendors.
Facilitated high-value meetings and agile rituals for teams throughout the organization.
Designed both a technical and cultural plan for adopting agile software development and DevOps philosophies for both internal and client teams
Evangelized the practices of continuous integration, delivery, and deployment as well as the techniques for sustainable architecture
Unified production, test, and dev environments by introducing configuration management, virtualization, and containerization
Led initiatives and training sessions for both AWS and GCE platforms and assisted teams transitioning from bare metal to the cloud.
Taught the practices of writing and maintaing alerting systems to enable a "you build it you run it" culture
Created a CI/CD pipeline using Travis-Ci and Google Container Engine

Led a cultural shift within the company by pairing with developers on multiple different teams to teach TDD, and pair programming, as well as sharing knowledge on continuous integration and delivery enabling teams to increase their delivery cadence from weekly to daily.
Designed and trained members of their QA practice to change from manual testing to automated behavioral acceptance testing using Robot Framework.
Migrated much of our AWS infrastructure to Terraform from web managed or Chef scripts.
Designed and implemented continuous delivery and deployment pipelines in TeamCity.
Created reproducible environments for development, testing, and production using Vagrant, Ansible, and Docker.
Maintained the operation and deployment of hosted customer installations for both US and Canadian clients.
Designed support tools such as the monitoring and alerting application, and our environment manager.
Acted as a liaison with offices in New York, Toronto, London, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and San Francisco to improve global operations.
Provided tier two support for customer software and hardware issues, then oversaw the correction of those issues.
